result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:51 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Austin Taylor Koeckeritz appeared by video.  Attorney Katie J Bosworth appeared by video for Austin Taylor Koeckeritz.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Witness in court with victims. Court reviews case and protective order. Attorney comments re: protective order. Atty Bosworth does not object to the order as written. Court grants the State's request per the order. An offer has been tendered.

Protective Order. Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc    to RMW
for Protective Order. Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc
Clerk of Court to DE requesting DE signature on bond and return 2 copies of bond in the SASE by 10/14/22. Bond mailed to the DE on 9/27/22. sf

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.M .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:34 PM CO: TCH for RMW, RPR: Melstrom, Clerk: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney A. Dolfi in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Austin Taylor Koeckeritz appeared by video. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Def is in custody in Pierce County. Clerk to mail bond to Pierce county for signature of bond.
